details.purpose: To record detailed findings about melanoma of skin found on microscopic examination.
details.use: To record detailed findings about microscopic examination of tissue. Use as a component archetype in the context of a suite of archetypes that make up a histopathology report ie OBSERVATION.lab_test.histopathology.
details.misuse: Not designed to be used within any other archetype other than OBSERVATION.lab_test.histopathology.

items.items: Microscopic anatomic pathology findings related to melanoma of skin.
Depth of tumour invasion. Commonly expressed as the Breslow thickness.

Breslow thickness is measured from the top of the granular layer of the epidermis or, if the surface is ulcerated, from the base of the ulcer, to the deepest dermal invasive cell.
This should be measured to nearest 0.1mm
Depth of tumour invasion. Measured to the nearest 0.1mm.

The Breslow thickness should be measured in the standard way when there is dermal regression (i.e. dermal regression extending to a greater thickness than the melanoma should not be included in the measurement of Breslow thickness).
Comment on invasion measurement issues or difficulties.
Grading of invasion of the melanoma.
Melanoma cells are confined to the epidermis (melanoma in situ).
Melanoma cells invade into but do not fill or expand the papillary (superficial) dermis.
Melanoma cells fill and expand the papillary dermis with extension of tumour to the papillary-reticular dermal interface.
Melanoma cells infiltrate into the reticular dermis.
Melanoma cells infiltrate into the subcutaneous fat.
Mitotic rate is a measure of the proliferation status of a cell population, expressed as the number of mitoses per square millimetre.
Distribution pattern of tumour infiltrating lymphocytes.
Extent of desmoplasia, expressed as a percentage of invasive component.
Finding of an associated benign melanocytic lesion.
Description of the melanoma growth pattern.
Findings related to tumour infiltrating lymphocytes.
Tumour infilitrating lyphocytes are present, with infiltration of the entire base of the tumour, or of diffuse permeation of the invasive melanoma.
There are focal areas of tumour infiltrating lymphocytes.
Tumour regression is present, involving less than 75% of the tumour.
Tumour regression is present, involving 75% or more of the tumour.
Details of in-situ tumour at the peripheral surgical margins.
Presence of tumour-associated ulceration has not been determined.
Presence of microsatellites has not been determined.
Presence of tumour infiltrating lymphocytes has not been determined.
The density of tumour infiltration has not been determined.
Description of the melanoma growth phase.
Findings related to growth pattern and growth phase.
Findings of any associated benign melanocytic lesions.
Findings of in-transit microsatellites has not been determined.
Presence of solar elastosis has not been determined.
Finding of a single predominant tumour cell type.
Spindle cells represent a predominant cell type.
Epithelioid cells represent a predominant cell type.
A predominant type of cell has not been determined.
Tumour regression is present. Extent, as a percentage, has not been determined.
Maximum distance of regression from the surgical margin.
The growth pattern has not been determined.
Presence of tumour regression has not been determined.
Presence of desmoplasia has not been determined.
Details of neurotropism or perineural invasion.
